description:
Been a YouTube Prime member for a few months now and for a few pence extra, you get a lot more bang for your bucks, compared with Spotify for instance. That aside, Coming over to Linux was like walking through a new sweet shop. All these new flavours of software to taste but having nothing to buy them with. Oh but hang on, what? Most times they're free?

This app is fine example of what Linux is all about for me. It works, that's all most users want, especially coming from Windbloats. Slick and inuitive just like the Android App. Say what you want about Google, but they do know their s**t.

I've heard people having problems with it not working on 18.04..... upgrade to 20.04. Problem solved, plus you get one hell of an OS as a back up, and that's coming from a life-long Windows user.
summary: Yet another eason to stay with Linux

Im on ubuntu 20.04 and its amazing so far, love the shortcuts keep up the amazing work.

The app worked for me in ubuntu 18.04. But it isn't a good service at all.
It seems to be just a service consuming YT API. I don't think anyone that really loves music would like it.

Today as many other days I start to work and start the app. But it required me to login again. Not a problem if you don't use 2FA as I do. It's just a "special" tab of Chrome, not a real app. It have all the memory problems Chrome has and it cooperates to all the crashes Chrome does.

Before I was used listen to Spotify and migrated my playlists to YTMusic as soon as I became YT Premium for budget reasons. Well I couldn't stand it for a year so I'm migrating back to Spotify as I was already using their app even with all the ads.

I suggest anyone to use all the services available in you region in the free mode. You really should choose the one you love the most in the free option. If you can't pay two o more services, don't pay for something that doesn't work well. It will be a waste of your money anyway.
